Platform.Title: M1, M3, M18 GAS Array
Platform.Description: oligonucleotide array containing unique ORFs rom M1, M3 and M18 Streptococcus pyogenes

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Spy Number; Comparable ORF# from Oklahoma Sequencing Project

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: Oligo sequence 5'-3' of probe spotted onto arrays

Column.Name: ORF length
Column.Description: full-length of ORF within genome

Column.Name: 5'end from ORF start
Column.Description: # of bp between 5' ORF and 5' probe

Column.Name: 3'end from ORF start
Column.Description: # of bp between 5' ORF and 3' probe

Column.Name: Bases from 3'end
Column.Description: # of bp between 5' probe and 3' ORF

Column.Name: Tm
Column.Description: melting temperature of probe

Column.Name: GC
Column.Description: % GC content of probe

Column.Name: M1 Cross hybrid. identity
Column.Description: next closest identity within genome of probe

Column.Name: M1 contiguous bases common to another sequence
Column.Description: # of bp within probe that are contiguous to another sequence within M1 genome

Column.Name: M3 Cross hybrid. identity
Column.Description: % identity of probe to M3 genome

Column.Name: M3 contiguous bases common to another sequence
Column.Description: # of bp within probe that are contiguous to another sequence within M3 genome

Column.Name: M18 Cross hybrid. identity
Column.Description: % identity of probe to M18 genome

Column.Name: M18 contiguous bases common to another sequence
Column.Description: # of bp within probe that are contiguous to another sequence within M18 genome

Sample.Title: MGAS315 1-3 Ex -1

Channel.Source: Pooled Exponential phase CsCl2 total RNA from M3 serotype GAS MGAS315
Channel.Characteristics: MGAS315 RNA prep: 1-3 Ex
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Pooled CsCl2 total RNA from M3 serotype GAS MGAS315
Channel.Characteristics: MGAS315 RNA preps: 1-9 Ex and 1-9 St
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Total RNA was isolated by CsCl2 method and labeled cDNA was generated using the Fairplay microarray labelling kit from Stratagene using random hexamers. Labeled cDNA was purified using QiaQuick PCR purification columns from Qiagen and concentrated using Microcon YM30 columns from Amicon. The amount of incorporated label was determined by measuring the absorbance at 550nm (Cy3) or 650nm (Cy5). 60 pmol each of Cy-dye (reference cDNA (Cy5) and test cDNA (Cy3)) were combined in 60 ml hybridization buffer 1 (Ambion), denatured and hybridized to the array at 42°C for at least 16 h, followed by subsequent washes. Output data (F635 mean-B635, F532 mean-B532, flags) was filtered to set any spots that did not exceed 2SD above a background threshold to the threshold value to avoid spurious expression ratios. Remaining spots were averaged, filtered to remove genes not present in MGAS315 (the strain examined) and normalized before statistical analysis.
Sample.Data-Processing: Growth phase specific normalization after removing genes not present in MGAS315. Condition-specific normalization: Following data filtration and ratio of signal calculations, the data from each array was adjusted and normalized so that valid comparisons could be made between experiments. Because the total level of transcript in the conditions being compared (stationary vs. exponential phase) was not similar, we compared the relative abundance of the transcript in one phase to its relative abundance in the other phase using two normalization steps. First, an average for the total signal of the six arrays from each growth phase was calculated (1256 was the average in exponential phase and 389 was the average in stationary phase). To correct for signal variations between replicate arrays, the value for each gene was adjusted by a factor so that the total signal for each array was equal to the average for the six in that growth phase. Second, the value for each gene adjusted for differences between replicates was divided by the average total signal in exponential phase. Normalized data was then log2 transformed, and statistical analysis and fold changes in expression in stationary phase versus exponential phase were obtained using Significance Analysis of Microarrays (SAM) software

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: same as UNF_VALUE but with flagged values removed

Column.Name: Non-Log Ratio
Column.Description: ratio of 532/635 after normalization

Column.Name: F635 Median - B635
Column.Description: original data from gpr file of the mean of the 635 feature - background 635

Column.Name: F532 Median - B532
Column.Description: original data from gpr file of the mean of the 532 feature - background 532

Column.Name: Flags
Column.Description: original data from gpr file, flag data about each spot

Column.Name: UNF_VALUE
Column.Description: log ratio of 532/635 after normalization

Channel.Characteristics: MGAS315 RNA preps: 1-9 Ex and 1-9 St
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Total RNA was isolated by CsCl2 method and labeled cDNA was generated using the Fairplay microarray labelling kit from Stratagene using random hexamers. Labeled cDNA was purified using QiaQuick PCR purification columns from Qiagen and concentrated using Microcon YM30 columns from Amicon. The amount of incorporated label was determined by measuring the absorbance at 550nm (Cy3) or 650nm (Cy5). 60 pmol each of Cy-dye (reference cDNA (Cy5) and test cDNA (Cy3)) were combined in 60 ml hybridization buffer 1 (Ambion), denatured and hybridized to the array at 42�C for at least 16 h, followed by subsequent washes. Output data (F635 mean-B635, F532 mean-B532, flags) was filtered to set any spots that did not exceed 2SD above a background threshold to the threshold value to avoid spurious expression ratios. Remaining spots were averaged, filtered to remove genes not present in MGAS315 (the strain examined) and normalized before statistical analysis.
Sample.Data-Processing: Growth phase specific normalization after removing genes not present in MGAS315. Condition-specific normalization: Following data filtration and ratio of signal calculations, the data from each array was adjusted and normalized so that valid comparisons could be made between experiments. Because the total level of transcript in the conditions being compared (stationary vs. exponential phase) was not similar, we compared the relative abundance of the transcript in one phase to its relative abundance in the other phase using two normalization steps. First, an average for the total signal of the six arrays from each growth phase was calculated (1256 was the average in exponential phase and 389 was the average in stationary phase). To correct for signal variations between replicate arrays, the value for each gene was adjusted by a factor so that the total signal for each array was equal to the average for the six in that growth phase. Second, the value for each gene adjusted for differences between replicates was divided by the average total signal in exponential phase. Normalized data was then log2 transformed, and statistical analysis and fold changes in expression in stationary phase versus exponential phase were obtained using Significance Analysis of Microarrays (SAM) software

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: same as UNF_VALUE but with flagged values removed

Column.Name: Non-Log Ratio
Column.Description: ratio of 532/635 after normalization

Column.Name: F635 Median - B635
Column.Description: original data from gpr file of the mean of the 635 feature - background 635

Column.Name: F532 Median - B532
Column.Description: original data from gpr file of the mean of the 532 feature - background 532

Column.Name: Flags
Column.Description: original data from gpr file, flag data about each spot

Column.Name: UNF_VALUE
Column.Description: log ratio of 532/635 after normalization

Sample.Title: MGAS315 7-9 St -2

Channel.Source: Pooled Stationary phase CsCl2 total RNA from M3 serotype GAS MGAS315
Channel.Characteristics: MGAS315 RNA prep: 7-9 St
Channel.Label: Cy3

Output data (F635 mean-B635, F532 mean-B532, flags) was filtered to set any spots that did not exceed 2SD above a background threshold to the threshold value to avoid spurious expression ratios. Remaining spots were averaged, filtered to remove genes not present in MGAS315 (the strain examined) and normalized before statistical analysis.

To correct for signal variations between replicate arrays, the value for each gene was adjusted by a factor so that the total signal for each array was equal to the average for the six in that growth phase. Second, the value for each gene adjusted for differences between replicates was divided by the average total signal in exponential phase. Series.Title: GAS M3 serotype, exponential versus stationary phase
Series.Summary: MGAS315 is a wild type strain. RNA isolated in exponential phase and stationary phase were compared Keywords: Growth phase comparison
Series.Overall-Design: Paired RNA samples were prepared (Ex and St) from nine independent cultures of MGAS315. Reference RNA consisted of pooled RNA from each preparation, labelled with Cy5
